Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
Concrete Board implementation using a simple 2D int matrix as the background and a BrickGenerator to provide pieces. This implementation is not thread-safe and is intended to be used from the game loop / JavaFX thread. Many return values are snapshots or direct references to internal structures; callers should treat returned arrays as read-only unless explicitly documented otherwise.

      Move the active brick down by one cell if the space below is free.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickDown in interface Board
      Returns:
      true when the piece moved; false when blocked (the caller will usually lock the piece after a failed move).

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotate the active brick counter-clockwise. This implementation will attempt a series of wall-kick translations when the straightforward rotation would intersect other cells or the board edges.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true when the rotation (possibly with kicks) succeeded, false when no valid placement could be found.

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawn a new active brick taken from the configured BrickGenerator and position it near the top of the board.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the newly spawned piece immediately intersects the current board (a typical signal that the board is full / game over). Callers should treat true as a collision.

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Return the internal board matrix. This implementation returns the internal reference for efficiency â€” callers MUST NOT mutate the returned array. Use MatrixOperations.copy(int[][]) to obtain a defensive copy when needed.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      the board matrix (rows x cols).

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Create and return a ViewData snapshot describing the current active piece position and the next-piece preview. The returned snapshot is immutable from the caller's perspective.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      a ViewData instance suitable for rendering.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Lock the active brick into the background matrix, merging its cells into the static board content. After calling this the board should typically call clearRows() to remove any completed lines.
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Remove any completed rows from the board and return a ClearRow describing the result (new matrix, lines removed and score bonus).
      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Reset the board state to start a new game: clear the matrix, reset the score and spawn the first active piece.
      Specified by:
      newGame in interface Board

    • swapCurrentWithNext

      public boolean swapCurrentWithNext()
      Swap the current active piece with the generator's next piece. The method first peeks at the generator's next piece and attempts to place it at the current offset. If the placement collides the swap is rejected and the board state is restored. When the generator supports replacing its head the original current piece is inserted back into the queue; otherwise a best-effort fallback is used.
      Specified by:
      swapCurrentWithNext in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the swap succeeded, false on failure (for example due to collision or generator returning null).

    • getUpcomingBricks

      public List<Brick> getUpcomingBricks(int count)
      Return a list of upcoming bricks from the generator. The returned list is produced by the generator and callers must not rely on mutating it.
      Specified by:
      getUpcomingBricks in interface Board
      Parameters:
      count - number of upcoming pieces requested
      Returns:
      a list of upcoming Brick instances
